page.title: 18BELIEF & WORSHIP IN AVENING
page.content: The{RELIGION }of people living in the block is almost exclusively { {CHRISTIAN}.Seventy-one percent of the people interviewed said that they were {ANGLICAN}and worshipped at the "Holy Cross" Parish church of Avening, built in 1080. Of the remainder, most were {BAPTIST}and worship at the Baptist Chapel in the High Street, built in 1805. However, the lay-preacher, the only Chapel official living in Avening, Mr Frank Smith, said that his congregation had shrunk in recent years. When the Chapel was extended in 1903 to provide a large schoolroom, fifty children attended Sunday School. Today there are fewer than twenty regular worshippers including a few children. Seven percent said that they were atheist and seven percent Roman Catholic. People living on the nearby Municipal Estate preferred the Chapel.
